Description in input context: Deletion of the C terminus abrogated the association of parkin with cellular membranes and induced rapid misfolding and aggregation.
Four N-terminal missense mutations, located within the ubiquitin-like domain (UBL), decrease the stability of parkin; as a consequence, these mutants are rapidly degraded by the proteasome.
A smaller parkin species of 42 kDa, which is present in extracts prepared from human brain and cultured cells, originates from an internal start site and lacks the N-terminal UBL domain.

Description: Parkinson's disease (PD) is caused by the loss of function of parkin due to various mutations.
The parkin gene encodes a 465 amino acid protein with an ubiquitin-like domain (UBL) at the N terminus and two RING finger motifs close to the C terminus.
